verses.text: And the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* spake unto Moses , saying ,

If a soul sin , and commit a trespass against the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, and lie unto his neighbour in that which was delivered him to keep, or in fellowship , or in a thing taken away by violence , or hath deceived his neighbour ;\f + \fr 6.2 \ft in fellowship: or, in dealing\f*\f + \fr 6.2 \ft fellowship: Heb. putting of the hand\f*
Or have found that which was lost , and lieth concerning it, and sweareth falsely ; in any of all these that a man doeth , sinning therein :

Then it shall be, because he hath sinned , and is guilty , that he shall restore that which he took violently away , or the thing which he hath deceitfully gotten , or that which was delivered him to keep , or the lost thing which he found ,

Or all that about which he hath sworn falsely ; he shall even restore it in the principal , and shall add the fifth part more thereto, \add and\add* give it unto him to whom it appertaineth, in the day of his trespass offering.\f + \fr 6.5 \ft in the day…: or, in the day of his being found guilty: Heb. in the day of his trespass\f*
And he shall bring his trespass offering unto the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, a ram without blemish out of the flock , with thy estimation , for a trespass offering , unto the priest :
And the priest shall make an atonement for him before the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*: and it shall be forgiven him for any thing of all that he hath done in trespassing therein. \p
¶ And the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* spake unto Moses , saying ,

Command Aaron and his sons , saying , This \add is\add* the law of the burnt offering : It \add is\add* the burnt offering , because of the burning upon the altar all night unto the morning , and the fire of the altar shall be burning in it.\f + \fr 6.9 \ft because…: or, for the burning\f*

And the priest shall put on his linen garment , and his linen breeches shall he put upon his flesh , and take up the ashes which the fire hath consumed with the burnt offering on the altar , and he shall put them beside the altar.
And he shall put off his garments , and put on other garments , and carry forth the ashes without the camp unto a clean place.

And the fire upon the altar shall be burning in it; it shall not be put out : and the priest shall burn wood on it every morning , and lay the burnt offering in order upon it; and he shall burn thereon the fat of the peace offerings.
The fire shall ever be burning upon the altar ; it shall never go out. \p
¶ And this \add is\add* the law of the meat offering : the sons of Aaron shall offer it before the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, before the altar.

And he shall take of it his handful , of the flour of the meat offering , and of the oil thereof, and all the frankincense which \add is\add* upon the meat offering , and shall burn \add it\add* upon the altar \add for\add* a sweet savour , \add even\add* the memorial of it, unto the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*.
And the remainder thereof shall Aaron and his sons eat : with unleavened bread shall it be eaten in the holy place ; in the court of the tabernacle of the congregation they shall eat it.

It shall not be baken with leaven. I have given it \add unto them for\add* their portion of my offerings made by fire ; it \add is\add* most holy , as \add is\add* the sin offering , and as the trespass offering.

All the males among the children of Aaron shall eat of it. \add It shall be\add* a statute for ever in your generations concerning the offerings of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* made by fire : every one that toucheth them shall be holy. \p
¶ And the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* spake unto Moses , saying ,

This \add is\add* the offering of Aaron and of his sons , which they shall offer unto the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* in the day when he is anointed ; the tenth part of an ephah of fine flour for a meat offering perpetual , half of it in the morning , and half thereof at night.

In a pan it shall be made with oil ; \add and when it is\add* baken , thou shalt bring it in: \add and\add* the baken pieces of the meat offering shalt thou offer \add for\add* a sweet savour unto the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*.
And the priest of his sons that is anointed in his stead shall offer it: \add it is\add* a statute for ever unto the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*; it shall be wholly burnt.
For every meat offering for the priest shall be wholly burnt : it shall not be eaten. \p
¶ And the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* spake unto Moses , saying ,

Speak unto Aaron and to his sons , saying , This \add is\add* the law of the sin offering : In the place where the burnt offering is killed shall the sin offering be killed before the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*: it \add is\add* most holy.
The priest that offereth it for sin shall eat it: in the holy place shall it be eaten , in the court of the tabernacle of the congregation.
Whatsoever shall touch the flesh thereof shall be holy : and when there is sprinkled of the blood thereof upon any garment , thou shalt wash that whereon it was sprinkled in the holy place.
But the earthen vessel wherein it is sodden shall be broken : and if it be sodden in a brasen pot , it shall be both scoured , and rinsed in water.
All the males among the priests shall eat thereof: it \add is\add* most holy.

And no sin offering , whereof \add any\add* of the blood is brought into the tabernacle of the congregation to reconcile \add withal\add* in the holy \add place\add*, shall be eaten : it shall be burnt in the fire.
